page.title: 14Clive Village Hall and Club
page.content: Clive Village Hall is the main meeting point for the villagers. It is used most days of the week both in the day and in the evening for a great variety of activities.These include evening classes in upholstry, flower-arranging local history,art and other educational areas of study, as well as Bingo, dances and discos for the residents.The children use the Hall as a Youth Club and Amateur Dramatics for both children and adults takes place here. The Village club near the Village Hall was built by the grandfather of Louise Page who has contributed to this survey on Pages 12 and 13. Her father also restored it in 1983. This club now houses a bar and a room for darts, pool and snooker. It is hired out for private functions such as parties and Country and Western evenings.
